issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description:
I need to uninstall some older SDKs and install a couple older ones (SDK 1.7 needs to be uninstalled, need to install 1.8.0).  I have the newer 2.0.1g a SDK.

I can't seem to find the SDK folders: http://developer.appcelerator.com/question/135903/cant-find-sdks--mobilesdks-folder-on-osx

THis makes installation/uninstallation impossible.  Really need this help.
fields.summary: Unable to find mobileSDKs or Titanium folder in spotlight to uninstall a mobileSDK on OSX

comments.body:
Hey Prashant,

I just replied to the community Q&A link you posted. Let me know if it solves your issue!

Hi Junaid,

No. I've already tried those folders and none of them seem to have the mobilesdk folders :-(

Via IRC - Prashant managed to fix the issue by doing the following:

*in Lion they changed this to hidden folders
*the trick is to goto Finder and then user the Go --> Goto Folder and type in ~/Library
*and it'll bring it up
*just wanted to let you know since u said someone else also had this issue. It's a Lion thing.
Closing it since the issue has been resolved.
